website_summaries.verdict: The Oculus Rift now offers a great combination of controls and apps for next-level VR and some room tracking, but it offers a less expansive experience than the Vive.
pros: The Oculus Touch controllers add impressive finger and hand movement, plus physical buttons for traditional games
The Rift headset is well-designed and compact
A strong collection of software offers many apps to explore
cons: The motion tracking lacks the HTC Vive's full-room scale
It takes a while to adjust to the controls
Total cost of headset plus controllers is expensive -- and that doesn't include the pricey gaming PC you need, too

website_summaries.verdict: The Oculus Rift is a powerful, PC-tethered VR headset that's even more appealing now thanks a lower price and the inclusion of Oculus Touch motion controllers.
pros: Works with Oculus and SteamVR platforms
Now includes both conventional gamepad and Oculus Touch controllers
cons: Requires four USB ports (three 3.0, one 2.0) to fully function

I can sympathize with Oculus since a higher resolution would make it even more demanding in terms of graphics, but the great thing about resolution is that you can downscale if needed. I am definitely looking forward to a higher resolution Rift in the near future!

The future of VR is exciting and I suspect that these early models provide a great induction to this technology. Cons for me are lack of roomscale without additional purchase of sensor and fogging of lens during summer. These are minor issues that can both be corrected and are minor issues.

I'm using a GTX 1080 card, and there is no detectable lag from head movement to image update, so there is no motion sickness. (or VR sickness.) In my old age, I tend to be more sensitive to that than other people. I'm an EE, and I'm amazed they can track head movement to such a fine resolution.

Supposedly it did not work on non-oculus computers, but I think that has been fixed now, but you still need to look into the necessary specs before purchasing this product, so you do not end up getting disappointed like me! It is otherwise great, and it was so much fun exploring the VR world!

It works far better than my dad's Gear VR for his Note 8, but not quite as good as my friend's Vive. customer_reviews.title: Great with two sensors, AMAZING with three
customer_reviews.text: The Rift is very immersive and great as long as you have the PC to back it up (which is something that should always be mentioned). Adding a third sensor to the mix lets you get the most out of the system, since it gives you room scale for playing games that let you walk around your space. The Touch controllers are capacitive so that games that use it can sense some of your fingers lifting from its grasp to let you point and wave or make a fist, and they fit very snug in your hands. With the three sensors, I would put this system slightly above the Vive for a perfect set up.

customer_reviews.title: Far better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I tried to temper my expectations because VR tech is still new, but the experience is more polished than I thought it would be. I do feel a sense of immersion, but what I especially enjoy are the small details: the "guardian system" which displays a transparent wall around your play area to help prevent you from bumping into things, and the fact that you can see the location of your controllers even when they are not in your hands (so that you can just reach out and pick them up off your desk). The technology has already come a long way and I can't wait to experience future generations of the Rift.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product for the price. You must have a super high end graphics card and powerful PC. In addition, you really need the Inateck KT5002 Superspeed USB 3.0 PCI-E card. It is critical to run your Oculus headset and all sensors thru this independent USB card on your PC motherboard. The native USB 3.0 ports on your PC will not handle it. I had all kinds of problems and tracking errors, but once I added the Inateck card, everything worked perfectly.

The default face isnt comfortable and soaks up sweat so you will want an aftermarket face rest... it also loses tracking often, and struggles to keep up with fast paced gameplay. If you are in the market for this, you probably already understand the setup required to get it working outside the oculus home for steam, but if you aren’t aware please do your research. It isn’t a bad product, but I recommend the vive over this, spend a few hundred dollars more to get the most out of your money.

customer_reviews.author: Aquarius

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but the software is loaded with Facebook ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but the software is loaded with Facebook buying 'opportunities'. While many games/travel packages are great, this technology isn't ready for prime time yet (consider waiting a generation or two). My son has a Vive and said the Oculus is more comfortable (and cheaper). If you have a fast computer (check HW requirements) and have the money to experiment, the Oculus is an enjoyable distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Ranchodoug

customer_reviews.title: Made me feel sick when using.
customer_reviews.text: Was initially stolen after delivery left out the front. Amazon refunded. Then bough again on eBay. After a heap of hassle getting, this VR made me feel sick when using. So only used a few times. For me, waste of money. Maybe it's ok for other people, I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Hearne

customer_reviews.title: Cool but over time has problems
customer_reviews.text: Of course having a virtual reality headset is cool but it is easy to get annoyed and sick of it. My computer easily runs the games and handles the headset but for some reason things still crash, and at first the vr seems really trippy and weird but then like anything your body gets used to it and it dosent feel different or cool anymore. Also the lenses of the headset constantly get foggy and dirty so you have to constantly clean them, and lastly it easily strains your eyes which alone reduces the amount of time you can actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten S Rahm

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Oculus Rift and the Oculus Go and I can say they are both great products at a great price. I originally purchased the Oculus Go and was hesitant on purchasing the Rift because I thought it would be hard to set up. But any gamer should have no trouble. I am using it on the MSI GS65 Stealth laptop and it works great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: POWERBALLWIN84

customer_reviews.title: This is a blast!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little techie to set up and use. Need a computer that can handle VR. Did not work at first until I figured out yo unneeded an HMDI cable from your monitor to the graphics card. I suppose a techie may say that was obvious but it wasn't to me. Totally transforms you not a new space. Some of the games are tweaking but they are getting better. Can't really compare it to the competition--not techie enough to know what else is out there, but this is a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Les Rosen

customer_reviews.title: If you have a high end PC and money to spare, go this route.
customer_reviews.text: In terms of gaming, you really aren't missing much if you skip VR for now. Standard gaming obviously has many more options and honestly they are of better quality in pretty much every department. The immersion factor from VR is negated by the fact that you will most likely be doing shorter gaming sessions. I have also yet to find an RPG of comparable value to non-vr titles. Sure, you can get fallout 4 or Skyrim but they aren't more immersive in VR. I would go to a VR arcade and try out the system a few times before purchasing. On another note, you will have to buy a 3rd sensor for the motion tracking to be spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Shlean

customer_reviews.title: I can't describe the sensation of vr, it's unreal
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this system, I've used both this and the HTC vive and I have to say the oculus touch controllers make all the difference in the world. The touch controllers are so comfortable and responsive it's amazing! I will admit the display isn't as clear or as immersive as I'd like, a wider field of view would be a huge improvement, and of course a higher resolution would be all the better as long as it didn't effect gameplay too much. No regrets with this purchase, totally amazing experience.
customer_reviews.author: sinister

customer_reviews.title: Nothing against the product itself, just be mindful when ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing against the product itself, just be mindful when purchasing that this can create motion issues. My son said these made him incredibly dizzy and sadly couldn't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Vive is better
customer_reviews.text: Still a nice headset but it has a lot of issues. The controllers use batteries which don't last long, compared to charging with a cord. Harder to adjust for your eyes, heavier than the Vive. Less games are available, takes longer to come up. Can mount the sensors for the Vive, had to buy shelves to make their sensors work and not be in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: The experience is worth it, but the cable management/extension is a big headache
customer_reviews.text: VR in 2019 should not be this expensive, not when the headset is nearly as old as Xbox one. That said, the experience is definitely worth every penny. My one complaint is that the sensor cords are way too short for a room setup. I had to use extension cables, which caused the sensors to drop out of connection whenever they feel like it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the Future
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this VR system! Once we got it up and running we were amazed with just the little intro game "First Contact". I did run into some issues with installation but I think it was the fact that my laptop had some bad drivers. After trying everything that came up in the forums, the last option was to do a full factory reset and reinstall windows. Since my laptop has 2 drives (SSD for the OS and a 1TB HDD for storage) this was not a big deal. After a fresh install of windows and re-installation of the Oculus software, we were up and running in under 10 mins.
customer_reviews.author: C. Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built works great.
customer_reviews.text: The Rift system is awesome for us. Bit the Oculus software has issues So far I had issues with buying games as the query fails The updates have made it stop working and has to be repaired to be used again takes a long time to repair However when the 4 free games wouldn't show up I contacted Oculus support using email and after they investigated it I was promptly fixed after I sent all info they needed. Great service so far and love the Oculus system.
customer_reviews.author: Thula7

customer_reviews.title: It has problems, especially with USB compatibility (run the ...
customer_reviews.text: It has problems, especially with USB compatibility (run the damn program on their site before you buy), is rather rubbish without the 3rd sensor, and unlike the Vive, the controllers cause me severe pain to use more than 20-30 minutes (so I don't use it as much as I'd like) . . .but that last one's a straight-up handicap so not fair to blame them for being *too* well suited to a "normal" hand I guess :P. Worth the money until the next gen.
customer_reviews.author: Ailith

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. Great for the price when working
customer_reviews.text: Huge design flaw in the side adjustment straps, after a decent amount of time owning it the side straps being adjusted in certain ways will cause a ribbon cable which provides audio to loose its ability to function leaving you with no audio at times. Poor design. Great for the price when working, but I switched to a Vive and the visual quality along with tracking quality are FAR better. Would recommend getting a Vive with Audio Strap add-on for best experience for VR and use a tool called ReVive to play Oculus exclusives with the vive.
customer_reviews.author: Aliquem

customer_reviews.title: Touch Controllers > Vive
customer_reviews.text: The controllers feel amazing, and the batteries are replaceable with external rechargeable AA's. My friend's year old vive controllers die every 4-5 hours of game play and require recharging. The batteries also last forever, idk how. If you turn vibration off the batteries only need to be changed monthly. Headset is lightweight, easy to setup. I got an extra sensor (3 total) and an 8ft cube of room scale VR. vive controller emulator allows me to play vive exclusive games (fallout4). This thing is kick ass. great price.
customer_reviews.author: grant

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This is way more fun than I expected. Check all specifications carefully though. It uses up a lot of USB ports AND bandwidth. I never knew USB bandwidth could be a potential issue. I cannot get a 3rd sensor for this reason. You need to be able to use two different USB controllers (like USB 2.0 for one sensor and USB 3.0 for everything else) to handle the USB bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: this_guy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool...
customer_reviews.text: If you're really into flight sims, racing games etc. and have some cash to burn I'd say this is worth it...so long as you either aren't using a keyboard a whole lot, or are familiar enough with your control layout to do it (mostly) by feel. But as for VR-specific games etc.? Still cool but not really worth it yet. They need significantly higher resolution, wireless capability, and better ventilation/more easily changeable face padding at a bare minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Batman_Bin_SuparmanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family, even non-gamers
customer_reviews.text: We had a DK2, which was cool, but only really shined with driving games (Dirt Rally, in fact). Recently got the CV1, and holysmokes - the walk-around the room and Touch controllers add a lot. Gnomes & Goblins charmed the non-gamers, Space Pirate Trainer and Robo Recall enchanted the kids (and me), and Google Earth blew everyone away. It looks like it will be used quite a bit every week. Just BTW: we chose this over the Vive because of the non-need to permanently install the tracking cameras, which is really impossible in our shared dining room / playspace. The ability to set it up and take it down quickly is what won us over on the Oculus.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan McNamee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this along with the "Acer Predator Helios 300 Gaming Laptop, Intel Quad Core i7 Processor, GeForce GTX 1060 6GB Graphics, 15.6" Full HD, 16GB DDR4, 256GB SSD, Red Backlit Keyboard, Metal Chassis, G3-571-77QK - VR Ready " All seems to be working great! Love the free games! hope they keep adding more!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gholson

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: If you're up for the steep price, this thing is amazing! Transports you anywhere in the world. You feel like you're really there, even in impossible places like the top of the Eiffel Tower! However, be careful and maintain this product well. It has some cords and doodads and gadgets, and it helps if you know what you're doing. This is a toy, but a very expensive toy. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ceara Struck

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Controllers
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 1 week and the trigger buttons started sticking. I requested a replacement. The replacement was USED, and again, within a week of use, the trigger buttons where sticking again... Worst controllers I've ever seen on any system ever. They are WAY too cheap. There is cheap, and then there is garbage. These controllers are trash.... And a replacement set is 100 USD... Are they insane? a Good Study Xbox controller is barley 65.00 and it lasts for a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and load software for use.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I were able to setup the Oculus and sensors in only a couple of hours. Most of the time was allocated to installing the software, its' a large program and with our rural internet speed it took about 1 1/2. Katlyn has been playing the game daily I have to remind her to get off and rest. I am also excited to see how much exercise she is getting while playing the game. She has lost a good 10 pounds in just a few months with the moving and jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Bratcher

customer_reviews.title: This is what we've been waiting for
customer_reviews.text: When I was a kid in the 80's this is exactly what I dreamt about. I got the Oculus instead of the Vive because reviewers said the Oculus controllers were a more intuitive interface to VR. Many games are released before they're done, so you have to deal with things that aren't fully cooked. But it's all great!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Claydon

customer_reviews.title: It's the future!!!
customer_reviews.text: Virtual Reality is here, what are you waiting for??? Amazing device, the latest Oculus Dreamdeck update makes it even better. Running on i6 GTX 1070 with 32 GB Ram, getting great performance. IMO this headset is better than the HTC Vive because of the Oculus Touch controllers, overall ease of use, number/Immersion of games (having hands instead of sticks helps), and the fact that it has a much lower price. Very happy with my Rift, will definitely be buying the Rift 2 when it drops.
customer_reviews.author: James Bellian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just needs HD stream cast to TV option
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line solid quality product! This ain't no middle of the mall type stuff. Very impressed with the design & comfort of the headset and controllers. All it needs is a built-in option to easily screen cast or airstream the Oculus Mirror to any smart tv or any Amazon Firestick type of device, wirelessly in HD and 4k without any lag.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lormand

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Great Gaming Experience -Great headset and controller tracking -Really slim and well-thought out design -Lots of controller features -Lots of headset adjustment -Great exclusive games Cons: -After a while you will get motion sick -Instead of a gtx 1060 or 1050 which is recommended you need atleast a 1070ti and an i7 or higher if you want the most optimal experience -Sensors randomly disconnect from time to time -the field of view needs improvement
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Nice VR System
customer_reviews.text: Nice VR System. Cons: The 3d resolution is ok, not as crisp as expected, and blurry when objects appear to close or too far away. It was also not clear when I purchased this on Amazon what caliber and type (Windows Only) hardware was required to run it. Controls are ok, some are frustrating, like popping up the menu constantly while trying to play (changed menu setting to long press to help with this.) Pros: Really fun and interactive games and Tools. Whole family loves playing on it. We have a fairly small space setup for it 5x6 ft and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: An eye opening experience, i'm not kidding. It brings depth to something that never truly had it before and drags you into another world. I put this thing on for the first time and was blown away. Its not something you can see by looking at your computer screen, you have to actually experience it with VR. The best way i could describe it is by compairing it to the first time i drove a car. The controllers drag you in even more, they feel perfect and i've beat mine up a few times on the dresser ... literally not a scratch on the controller haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spicy as heck 5/5
customer_reviews.text: First let me say the presentation of the oculus is beautiful, the setup was also super fast and easy. With this being one of my first experiences with the oculus I can say this is definitely worth 350$. I’ve tried both the oculus rift and the Htc vive and both are excellent but the oculus touch controllers are just 1 extra step towards a more immersive experience. Everything considered this is definitely a 5/5 product worth the buy. Another thing to add is that buying a few 3.0 usb extensions, another sensor, and a hdmi extender makes the experience a whole ton better in full 360.
customer_reviews.author: aboycalledjonny

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing experience. This arrived in great condition and has ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing experience. This arrived in great condition and has been working since its been received. No damage, not pre used, 100% perfect as expected. Pros its VR! Cons, very likely you will get sick, it seems everyone has at least some level of VR sickness at first but you can get past it! The reason Oculus was my choice over Vive or any others is because of the touch controllers and ability to supersaturate and play any platform VR game. I was not disappointed by any of these features. Honestly, I can't say there is literally anything I am disappointed about other than the lack of titles.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Incredible immersion. Easy, no fuss setup.
customer_reviews.text: The experience is so surreal. I didn't expect to be so immersed but I was wrong. The trackers do an incredible job tracking every movement with no lag what-so-ever. They're also easy to setup and isn't picky about their placements. I live in a small apartment and my room is quite tiny so if I can set it up without fuss, then anyone should be able to as well. Just be careful, you can easily lose yourself in the VR and forget where you are unaware of your surroundings.
customer_reviews.author: Mudig

customer_reviews.title: Works and good system. I have tried the Vive and Oculus ...
customer_reviews.text: Works and good system. I have tried the Vive and Oculus and decided to go with Oculus. The controllers and HMD are much more comfortable and lighter which is good for longer play. Can easily play Oculus and Steam games. Screen door effect is there but all of them have it at the moment. Field of view is smaller than the Vive but it never takes me out of the immersion. Some say it has light leaks at the nose area but the way I wear mine it does not. Its completely dark. I guess just depends on your head type.
customer_reviews.author: Jayway

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the argument with your wife.. :)
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. Buy it now, argue with your wife later. (Remind her of the expensive jewelry, purses or shoes that she has sitting in the closet). You put this on knowing that it's only VR and it's only a game you'll be playing; but when the robots (or zombies, etc) turn on you, all that rationale goes out the window! Some games produce motion sickness/queasiness in varying amounts, but most games have options to adjust comfort settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute game changer, must have item!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute game changer, must have item, and it is just the beginning! Some apps like Google Earth VR offer a kind of experience like nothing else I've experienced, exploring a place you've been on vacation is amazing. Terror games are really frightening, first person shooting is like the real thing. My daughter goes crazy sculpting in 3D and riding rollercoasters. Installation and calibration is not straightforward, I had to look at forums and manually input a script to bypass some broken verifications... Some friends felt seek after using certain apps, fortunately no me. Strongly recommend if you have a decent PC (i.e. i7 4790+, GTX970+)
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme Guidolin de Campos

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Bundle
customer_reviews.text: This bundle was a super deal over the other brands. I've never been a fan of Sony products and HTC's products have always been overpriced (and still are). So, when this bundle came along at a reduced price, I jumped on it. When it arrived, I was instantly impressed with the quality of the packaging and the VR itself. Setting up was a breeze. It works like a champ. My main go to VR game is Elite Dangerous which is a blast in VR.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Best headset on the market
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats oculus in terms of comfort and functionality, I am not a fanboy, I had Vive before and also Microsoft, not one of them can compete with oculus... yes the resolution is better on the Vive pro... but it's a bulky headset. uncomfortable to wear for longer periods as Microsoft Samsung odyssey.. plus the Oculus dash/home.. you simply can not beat that.... with any other headset on the market....
customer_reviews.author: T00nZ

customer_reviews.title: I STILL love it, despite of not working right headphone.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It fits me fine. Once I put it on - i'm in a different world. Controls are pretty comfortable for multiple games. There is nothing bad to say about it. UPDATE - less than three month and the right headphone stopped working. Apparently this is a common issue and have been known to Oculus for more than a year. I don't think I will use warranty replacement - this thing can happen again. I will either fix it myself of use wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: GRiG

customer_reviews.title: Have shown a dozen people this as a demo and everyone loved it. Some even want to build a computer ...
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal. Have shown a dozen people this as a demo and everyone loved it. Some even want to build a computer around it now. If your hardware supports it, up the supersampling rate for higher rendering of images. Can't get enough of this. Also a fan is your best fan to avoid any motion sickness.
customer_reviews.author: Static FL

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, over-hyped toy - no support
customer_reviews.text: Returned this twice. We researched the right laptop specs and bought what we thought was a compatible computer. Had a blank screen on the first one. Couldn't not get a response from "tech support." We were advised to look at the posted messages for a fix. Really????? Return the first one. Same blank screen. We did a reboot of the computer, updated the graphics card..... we tried every suggestion we found on the boards. We even had Amazon help call us twice to trouble shoot. Finally decided to return the hunk of plastic. How do you put out a product with very new technology and offer no tech support?
customer_reviews.author: Laryssa Shainberg

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer...pun intended
customer_reviews.text: This thing is literally a game changer by all definitions. It’s impossible to explain unless you try it. One of the coolest thing I’ve ever purchased! My wife hates video games and she even loves this. You’re doing yourself a disservice if you like video games, your computer can handle this, and you don’t get this. Just buy it, you won’t regret it! Although you should be prepared to spend lots of money on VR games cause they’re all amazing and addictive!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kragthorpe

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for someone and they have had lots of complaints for it. Issues and broken stuff after a week of getting it. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tony Quatraro

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a VR try another one. You are going to have a lot of problems with Oculus
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. If you have good luck you will receive a good working device, but in general oculus has bad products. You can read all about a lot of differents errors , malfunctions, problems and software/hardware or drivers issues online, in forums or any website. Mine only worked fine for 2 hours and after that never worked fine again. I did a lot of tests and changes in my hardware and software, also contacted Oculus support but no solution worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Amauri

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the best and is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best and is worth every penny! I even watch my movies on this thing and it feels like your at the movie theater, The sound is good and the immersion is like no other. If you want to experience what its like to be in a dog fight in space.... blast your enemy to bits with a weapon that feels like its in your hand... have the S*** scared out of you by the hoards of the damned.... then look no further my friend this is for you. love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: 4 star experience - hardware reliability disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The experience itself is pretty good, plenty of fun to be had. The hardware is another story. In less than a year had to replace one headset cable (non warranty) and three hand controllers (warranty). With a button is starting to fail on one of those. Tech support is ok, takes a few emails to get problems resolved, but they're pretty responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Twaz

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very Impressed. My wife got these for me for Xmas. I have been playing as much as I can. The biggest attraction is the feeling that you are in the game. I am looking forward to new game releases, maybe first shooter games. My wife was also impressed with it. It gets a little warm after play for a while, but that might just be me. I enjoy this more than just sitting behind a keyboard. I get some exercise.
customer_reviews.author: User

product_meta.title: Oculus Rift and Touch Controllers Bundle
product_meta.description:
Edition:Rift + Touch Controllers

Rift is unlike anything you've ever experienced. Whether you're stepping into your favourite game, watching an immersive VR movie, jumping to a destination on the other side of the world, or just spending time with friends in VR, you'll feel like you're really there.

Includes Oculus Touch controllers. Note this bundle does not include Xbox One Wireless Controller



BOX CONTAINS
Rift (w/cable and new facial interface);Sensor x2;Touch controllers;Printed Accessory Folio w/quick start;Manual;2 AA batteries;Lens Cloth;Audio tool;2 Oculus stickers

Riftʼs ultra low-latency tracking offers unparalleled immersion

Windows PC and internet connection required - review recommended specs to confirm system compatibility
